title: Facebook's Instagram boots ad partner, saying it improperly collected and stored info about users
text: Instagram on Wednesday sent a cease and desist letter to Hyp3r, a San Francisco marketing startup that was found to be improperly collecting public user.

title: Instagram ad partner secretly sucked up and tracked millions of users’ locations and stories
text: Hyp3r, an apparently trusted marketing partner of Facebook and Instagram, has been secretly collecting and storing location and other data on millions of users, against the policies of the social networks. It's hard to see how it could do this for years without intervention by the platforms except if the latter were either ignorant or complicit.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Is the Most Dangerous Person in the World, NYU's Galloway Says

He speaks with Bloomberg's Scarlet Fu and Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: Two US senators raise privacy concerns over Facebook's Messenger Kids
text: Democratic U.S. senators Edward Markey and Richard Blumenthal have written to Facebook questioning whether there was a "worrying pattern" of poor privacy protection for children using its Messenger Kids app.

title: Libra, Facebook’s global digital currency plan, is fuzzy on privacy, watchdogs warn
text: Privacy commissioners from the Americas, Europe, Africa and Australasia have put their names to a joint statement raising concerns about a lack of clarity from Facebook over how data protection safeguards will be baked into its planned cryptocurrency project, Libra. title: Instagram and Facebook are experiencing outages

title: Facebook to admit ownership of Instagram, WhatsApp in hard-to-read small-print

title: Why the FTC Is Scrutinizing Facebook's Acquisitions
text: Ashkan Soltani, former chief technology officer at the U.S. Federal Trade Commission, and Bloomberg's Kurt Wagner discuss why the FTC is scrutinizing Facebook Inc.'s acquisitions. They speak with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: The Wall Street Journal: FTC examining Facebook’s acquisitions as part of antitrust probe
text: The Federal Trade Commission is examining Facebook Inc.’s acquisitions as part of its antitrust investigation into the social-media giant — to determine if they were part of a campaign to snap up potential rivals before they could become a threat, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: FTC antitrust probe is reviewing Facebook's aquisitions: WSJ
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin shares details of a Wall Street Journal report that the Federal Trade Commission is reviewing Facebook's acquisitions.

title: FTC probes Facebook's acquisition practices - WSJ
text: The Federal Trade Commission is probing Facebook Inc  to check if the social media company's acquisitions were aimed at snapping up potential rivals before they could become a threat, reported the Wall Street Journal, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: Facebook drops on report FTC is looking at Instagram, WhatsApp acquisitions in antitrust probe
text: The Wall Street Journal reported Thursday that Facebook's acquisitions were a central element of the probe, citing sources.

title: Facebook's stock sinks after WSJ report of FTC probe into acquisitions
text: Shares of Facebook Inc. FB, -1.59% took a dive in afternoon trading Thursday, after The Wall Street Journal reported that the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust probe of the social media company was looking into acquisitions.
